title: Increase gameplay screen to medium size (Snake Arena)

requirements.text: Increase the Snake Arena gameplay area from the current small appearance to a medium-sized layout by updating the responsive sizing rules for the main gameplay container (the element with classes `game-container snake-game-container`) so it uses more of the available viewport on typical desktop/tablet screens while still fitting fully within the viewport.

quotes: You make so small make medium size screen

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop-sized viewports (e.g., ~1366Ã—768 and larger), the gameplay container renders noticeably larger than before (medium-sized) while still fully visible without requiring scrolling.
On mobile viewports (<=768px), the layout remains stable and does not overflow the viewport; the game container still fits within the visible area.
The gameplay container keeps a sensible game aspect ratio (currently 16:9) and does not become excessively small due to the aspect-ratio constraint.

requirements.text: Ensure the canvas viewport measurement and rendering scale correctly after the gameplay container size changes (so the `SnakeCanvas` continues to receive accurate `viewportWidth/viewportHeight` values from `useCanvasViewport` and the rendered canvas is crisp and fills the container).

quotes: You make so small make medium size screen

acceptanceCriteria: After resizing the gameplay container, the canvas fills the game board container with no letterboxing gaps caused by mismatched width/height styles.
Resizing the browser window updates the canvas dimensions appropriately (no stale sizing), and performance does not degrade due to excessive resize re-renders.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not modify the Internet Identity / actor hooks located in frontend immutablePaths.
nonGoals: Do not add new gameplay features, controls, levels, missions, or UI panels beyond resizing.
Do not introduce backend logic or persistence changes (backend remains unchanged).
